duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device that reported the event.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Network Activity.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The server responding to the tunnel connection.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

401499.caption: Tunnel Activity: Other
401499.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

4014.caption: Tunnel Activity
4014.description: Tunnel Activity events report secure tunnel establishment (such as VPN), teardowns, renewals, and other network tunnel specific actions.

protocol_name.caption: Tunnel Protocol
protocol_name.description: The networking protocol associated with the tunnel. E.g. IPSec, SSL, GRE.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Tunnel Activity.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: The initiator (client) of the tunnel connection.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

severity_id.description:

severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

tls.caption: TLS
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes, if available.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

600103.caption: Web Resources Activity: Update
600103.description: One or more web resources were updated.

600106.caption: Web Resources Activity: Import
600106.description: One or more web resources were imported into an Application.

600101.caption: Web Resources Activity: Create
600101.description: One or more web resources were created.

600102.caption: Web Resources Activity: Read
600102.description: One or more web resources were read / viewed.

600104.caption: Web Resources Activity: Delete
600104.description: One or more web resources were deleted.

600105.caption: Web Resources Activity: Search
600105.description: A search was performed on one or more web resources.

600107.caption: Web Resources Activity: Export
600107.description: One or more web resources were exported from an Application.

600108.caption: Web Resources Activity: Share
600108.description: One or more web resources were shared.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

6.caption: Application Activity
6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

6001.caption: Web Resources Activity
6001.description: Web Resources Activity events describe actions executed on a set of Web Resources.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Web Resources Activity.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the endpoint from which the request originated.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action was not mapped. See the action attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.name: cis_control
cis_control.description: The CIS Control (aka Critical Security Control) object describes a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors. The CIS Controls are defined by the Center for Internet Security.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Control name. For example: 4.8 Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS Control version. For example: v8.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Control description. For example: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.name: cve
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in CVE Program catalog (CVE). There is one CVE Record for each vulnerability in the catalog.

type.caption: Vulnerability Type
type.description:
The vulnerability type as selected from a large dropdown menu during CVE refinement.

Most frequently used vulnerability types are: DoS, Code Execution, Overflow, Memory Corruption, Sql Injection, XSS, Directory Traversal, Http Response Splitting, Bypass something, Gain Information, Gain Privileges, CSRF, File Inclusion. For more information see Vulnerabilities By Type distributions.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the CVE record.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A brief description of the CVE Record.

uid.caption: CVE ID
uid.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures unique number assigned to a specific computer vulnerability. A CVE Identifier begins with 4 digits representing the year followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CVE-2021-12345.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the CVE Record.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

deprecated.message: Use the cwe object attributes instead.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

digital_signature.caption: Digital Signature
digital_signature.name: digital_signature
digital_signature.description: The Digital Signature object contains information about the cryptographic mechanism used to verify the authenticity, integrity, and origin of the file or application.

digest.caption: Message Digest
digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The digital signature algorithm used to create the signature, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized digital signature algorithm.

3.caption: ECDSA
3.description: Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: DSA
1.description: Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA).

2.caption: RSA
2.description: Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) Algorithm.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

session.caption: Session
session.name: session
session.description: The Session object describes details about an authenticated session. e.g. Session Creation Time, Session Issuer. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Session.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of identical sessions spawned from the same source IP, destination IP, application, and content/threat type seen over a period of time.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal associated with the session. Ex: the tty or pts value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the session was created.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The reason which triggered the session expiration.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier of the session. e.g. AWS ARN - arn:aws:sts::123344444444:assumed-role/Admin/example-session.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the session was created.

file.caption: File
file.name: file
file.description: The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details. Defined by D3FEND d3f:File.

attributes.caption: Attributes
attributes.description: The bitmask value that represents the file attributes.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the file. For example: svchost.exe

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The user that owns the file/object.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The file type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The file version. For example: 8.0.7601.17514.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the file. For example: c:\windows\system32\svchost.exe.

signature.caption: Digital Signature
signature.description: The digital signature of the file.

modifier.caption: Modifier
modifier.description: The user that last modified the file.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product that created or installed the file.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the file, as returned by file system. For example: the description as returned by the Unix file command or the Windows file type.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the file as defined by the storage system, such the file system file ID.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

accessor.caption: Accessor
accessor.description: The name of the user who last accessed the object.

company_name.caption: Company Name
company_name.description: The name of the company that published the file. For example: Microsoft Corporation.

creator.caption: Creator
creator.description: The user that created the file.

mime_type.caption: MIME type
mime_type.description: The Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type of the file, if applicable.

parent_folder.caption: Parent Folder
parent_folder.description: The parent folder in which the file resides. For example: c:\windows\system32

accessed_time.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the file was created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the file was last modified.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description:
An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs where each pair represents a file or folder extended attribute.

For example: Windows alternate data stream attributes (ADS stream name, ADS size, etc.), user-defined or application-defined attributes, ACL, owner, primary group, etc. Examples from DCS:

  • ads_name
  • ads_size
  • dacl
  • owner
  • primary_group
  • link_name - name of the link associated to the file.
  • hard_link_count - the number of links that are associated to the file.

accessed_time_dt.caption: Accessed Time
accessed_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last accessed.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the file was created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the file was last modified.

group.caption: Group
group.name: group
group.description: The Group object represents a collection or association of entities, such as users, policies, or devices. It serves as a logical grouping mechanism to organize and manage entities with similar characteristics or permissions within a system or organization.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The group name.

type.caption: Account Type
type.description: The type of the group or account.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the group is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The group description.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the group. For example, for Windows events this is the security identifier (SID) of the group.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.name: cwe
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

uid.caption: CWE ID
uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration unique number assigned to a specific weakness. A CWE Identifier begins "CWE" followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CWE-123.

caption.caption: Caption
caption.description: The caption assigned to the Common Weakness Enumeration unique identifier.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: URL pointing to the CWE Specification. For more information see CWE.

rule.caption: Rule
rule.name: rule
rule.description: The Rule object describes characteristics of a rule associated with a policy or an event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the rule that generated the event.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The rule type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The rule version. For example: 1.1.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the rule that generated the event.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the rule that generated the event.

resource_details.caption: Resource Details
resource_details.name: resource_details
resource_details.description: The Resource Details object describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related resource group.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.name: analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The analytic version. For example: 1.1.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

api.caption: API
api.name: api
api.description: The API, or Application Programming Interface, object represents  information pertaining to an API request and response.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The information pertaining to the API group.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

request.caption: Request Elements
request.name: request
request.description: The Request Elements object describes characteristics of an API request.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api request.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique request identifier.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

http_header.caption: HTTP Header
http_header.name: http_header
http_header.description: TThe HTTP Header object represents the headers sent in an HTTP request or response. HTTP headers are key-value pairs that convey additional information about the HTTP message, including details about the content, caching, authentication, encoding, and other aspects of the communication.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the header

tls_extension.caption: TLS Extension
tls_extension.name: tls_extension
tls_extension.description: The TLS Extension object describes additional attributes that extend the base Transport Layer Security (TLS) object.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data contains information specific to the particular extension type.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The TLS extension type. For example: Server Name.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The TLS extension type identifier. See The Transport Layer Security (TLS) extension page.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: maximum_fragment_length
1.description: The Maximum Fragment Length Negotiation extension.

10.caption: supported_groups
10.description: The Supported Groups extension.

5.caption: status_request
5.description: The Certificate Status Request extension.

14.caption: use_srtp
14.description: The Use SRTP data protection extension.

15.caption: heartbeat
15.description: The Heartbeat extension.

16.caption: application_layer_protocol_negotiation
16.description: The Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation extension.

18.caption: signed_certificate_timestamp
18.description: The Signed Certificate Timestamp extension.

20.caption: server_certificate_type
20.description: The Server Certificate Type extension.

21.caption: padding
21.description: The Padding extension.

45.caption: psk_key_exchange_modes
45.description: The Pre-Shared Key Exchange Modes extension.

13.caption: signature_algorithms
13.description: The Signature Algorithms extension.

19.caption: client_certificate_type
19.description: The Client Certificate Type extension.

authorization.caption: Authorization Result
authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: The Authorization Result object provides details about the authorization outcome and associated policies related to activity.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the Identity/Access management policies that are applicable.

container.caption: Container
container.name: container
container.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The container name.

runtime.caption: Runtime
runtime.description: The backend running the container, such as containerd or cri-o.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the container image.

tag.caption: Image Tag
tag.description: The tag used by the container. It can indicate version, format, OS.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The full container unique identifier for this instantiation of the container. For example: ac2ea168264a08f9aaca0dfc82ff3551418dfd22d02b713142a6843caa2f61bf.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The container image used as a template to run the container.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Commit hash of image created for docker or the SHA256 hash of the container. For example: 13550340a8681c84c861aac2e5b440161c2b33a3e4f302ac680ca5b686de48de.

network_driver.caption: Network Driver
network_driver.description: The network driver used by the container. For example, bridge, overlay, host, none, etc.

orchestrator.caption: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The orchestrator managing the container, such as ECS, EKS, K8s, or OpenShift.

pod_uuid.caption: Pod UUID
pod_uuid.description: The unique identifier of the pod (or equivalent) that the container is executing on.

win/reg_key.caption: Registry Key
win/reg_key.name: reg_key
win/reg_key.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

security_descriptor.caption: Security Descriptor
security_descriptor.description: The security descriptor of the registry key.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

reputation.caption: Reputation
reputation.name: reputation
reputation.description: The Reputation object describes the reputation/risk score of an entity (e.g. device, user, domain).

base_score.caption: Reputation Score
base_score.description: The reputation score as reported by the event source.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the reputation information.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

8.caption: Possibly Malicious
8.description: Strong possibility of maliciousness.

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.name: firewall_rule
firewall_rule.description: The Firewall Rule object represents a specific rule within a firewall policy or event. It contains information about a rule's configuration, properties, and associated actions that define how network traffic is handled by the firewall.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the rule that generated the event.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The rule type.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The rule version. For example: 1.1.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the rule that generated the event.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the rule that generated the event.

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The rule response time duration, usually used for challenge completion time.

condition.caption: Condition
condition.description: The rule trigger condition for the rule. For example: SQL_INJECTION.

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

match_location.caption: Match Location
match_location.description: The location of the matched data in the source which resulted in the triggered firewall rule. For example: HEADER.

match_details.caption: Match Details
match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

scan.caption: Scan
scan.name: scan
scan.description: The Scan object describes characteristics of a proactive scan.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The administrator-supplied or application-generated name of the scan. For example: "Home office weekly user database scan", "Scan folders for viruses", "Full system virus scan"

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of scan.

uid.caption: Scan UID
uid.description: The application-defined unique identifier assigned to an instance of a scan.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type id of the scan.

3.caption: Updated Content
3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.

6.caption: User Logon
6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The scan type id is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Manual
1.description: The scan was manually initiated by the user or administrator.

2.caption: Scheduled
2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.

4.caption: Quarantined Items
4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.

5.caption: Attached Media
5.description: The scan was triggered by the attachment of removable media.

7.caption: ELAM
7.description: The scan was triggered by an Early Launch Anti-Malware (ELAM) detection.

hassh.caption: HASSH
hassh.name: hassh
hassh.description: The HASSH object contains SSH network fingerprinting values for specific client/server implementations. It provides a standardized way of identifying and categorizing SSH connections based on their unique characteristics and behavior.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The concatenation of key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms (separated by ';'). NOTE: This is not the underlying algorithm for the hash implementation.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The hash of the key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.name: load_balancer
load_balancer.description: The load balancer object describes the load balancer entity and contains additional information regarding the distribution of traffic across a network.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response status code detailing the connection from the load balancer to the destination target.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The load balancer message.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the load balancer.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the load balancer.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The request classification as defined by the load balancer.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The destination to which the load balancer is distributing traffic.

endpoint_connections.caption: Endpoint Connections
endpoint_connections.description: An object detailing the load balancer connection attempts and responses.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: General purpose metrics associated with the load balancer.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional status information about the load balancer distribution event.

metric.caption: Metric
metric.name: metric
metric.description: The Metric object defines a simple name/value pair entity for a metric.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the metric.

observable.caption: Observable
observable.name: observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the event data. For example: file.name.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The observable value type name.

value.caption: Value
value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

3.caption: MAC Address (Dictionary Type)
3.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

6.caption: URL String (Dictionary Type)
6.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

1.caption: Hostname (Dictionary Type)
1.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

2.caption: IP Address (Dictionary Type)
2.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

10.caption: Resource UID (Dictionary Type)
10.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

5.caption: Email Address (Dictionary Type)
5.description: Email address. For example: john_doe@example.com.

7.caption: File Name (Dictionary Type)
7.description: File name. For example: text-file.txt.

8.caption: Hash (Dictionary Type)
8.description: Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

9.caption: Process Name (Dictionary Type)
9.description: Process name. For example: Notepad.

11.caption: Port (Dictionary Type)
11.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

14.caption: Country (Dictionary Attribute)
14.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

15.caption: Process ID (Dictionary Attribute)
15.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

16.caption: HTTP User-Agent (Dictionary Attribute)
16.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

17.caption: CWE Object: uid (Object-Specific Attribute)
17.description: Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CWE Object.

18.caption: CVE Object: uid (Object-Specific Attribute)
18.description: Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CVE Object.

20.caption: Endpoint (Object)
20.description: The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

21.caption: User (Object)
21.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

22.caption: Email (Object)
22.description: The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Email.

23.caption: Uniform Resource Locator (Object)
23.description: The Uniform Resource Locator(URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL. Defined in RFC 1738 and by D3FEND d3f:URL.

24.caption: File (Object)
24.description: The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details. Defined by D3FEND d3f:File.

25.caption: Process (Object)
25.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Process.

26.caption: Geo Location (Object)
26.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address. Defined by D3FEND d3f:PhysicalLocation.

27.caption: Container (Object)
27.description: The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

29.caption: Registry Value (Object)
29.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

30.caption: Fingerprint (Object)
30.description: The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

12.caption: Subnet (Dictionary Type)
12.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet.
For example:
  • 192.168.1.0/24
  • 2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

13.caption: Command Line (Dictionary Attribute)
13.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

28.caption: Registry Key (Object)
28.description: The registry key object describes a Windows registry key. Defined by D3FEND d3f:WindowsRegistryKey.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

device.caption: Device
device.name: device
device.description: The Device object represents an addressable computer system or host, which is typically connected to a computer network and participates in the transmission or processing of data within the computer network. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Host.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the device belongs. For example: <code>["Windows Laptops", "Engineering"]<code/>.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The device type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The most recent discovery time of the device.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The network domain where the device resides. For example: work.example.com.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the device.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run the virtual machine.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The initial discovery time of the device.

is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the device. For example the Windows TargetSID or AWS EC2 ARN.

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

name.caption: Name
name.description:
The alternate device name, ordinarily as assigned by an administrator.

Note: The Name could be any other string that helps to identify the device, such as a phone number; for example 310-555-1234.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The most recent discovery time of the device.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

imei.caption: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Station Equipment Identifier that is associated with the device.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the device was known to have been created.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial discovery time of the device.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The region where the virtual machine is located. For example, an AWS Region.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The device IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the device was last known to have been modified.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the device.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: An alternate unique identifier of the device if any. For example the ActiveDirectory DN.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the device was known to have been created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the device, ordinarily as reported by the operating system.

hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor
hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

autoscale_uid.caption: Autoscale UID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the device was last known to have been modified.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the vulnerability.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.

affected_packages.caption: Affected Software Packages
affected_packages.description: List of software packages identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerabilities
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities that are related to this vulnerability.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

dns_answer.caption: DNS Answer
dns_answer.name: dns_answer
dns_answer.description: The DNS Answer object represents a specific response provided by the Domain Name System (DNS) when querying for information about a domain or performing a DNS operation. It encapsulates the relevant details and data returned by the DNS server in response to a query.

flags.caption: DNS Header Flags
flags.description: The list of DNS answer header flags.

type.caption: Resource Record Type
type.description: The type of data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: CNAME.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

class.caption: Resource Record Class
class.description: The class of DNS data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

flag_ids.caption: DNS Header Flags
flag_ids.description: The list of DNS answer header flag IDs.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event DNS header flag is not mapped.

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.name: cloud
cloud.description: The Cloud object contains information about a cloud account such as AWS Account ID, regions, etc.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

account.caption: Account
account.description: The account object describes details about the account that was the source or target of the activity.

project_uid.caption: Project ID
project_uid.description: The unique identifier of a Cloud project.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The unique name of the Cloud services provider, such as AWS, MS Azure, GCP, etc.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The name of the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The availability zone in the cloud region, as defined by the cloud provider.

product.caption: Product
product.name: product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.
