uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1595.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/.

response.caption: Response Elements
response.name: response
response.description: The Response Elements object describes characteristics of an API response.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response sent to a request.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api response.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The list of communication flags, normalized to the captions of the flag_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.name: location
location.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address. Defined by D3FEND d3f:PhysicalLocation.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code. For the complete list of country codes see ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

deprecated.message: Use specific lat, long attributes instead.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. Region codes are defined at ISO 3166-2 and have a limit of three characters. For example, see the region codes for the US.

san.caption: Subject Alternative Name
san.name: san
san.description: The Subject Alternative name (SAN) object describes a SAN secured by a digital certificate

name.caption: Name
name.description: Name of SAN (e.g. The actual IP Address or domain.)

type.caption: Type
type.description: Type descriptor of SAN (e.g. IP Address/domain/etc.)

user.caption: User
user.name: user
user.description: The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal. Defined by D3FEND d3f:UserAccount.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The username. For example, janedoe1.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the user. For example, System, AWS IAM User, etc.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the user is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique user identifier. For example, the Windows user SID, ActiveDirectory DN or AWS user ARN.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the user.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The administrative groups to which the user belongs.

3.caption: System
3.description: System account. For example, Windows computer accounts with a trailing dollar sign ($).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: User
1.description: Regular user account.

2.caption: Admin
2.description: Admin/root user account.

full_name.caption: Full Name
full_name.description: The full name of the person, as per the LDAP Common Name attribute (cn).

account.caption: Account
account.description: The user's account or the account associated with the user.

credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

ldap_person.caption: LDAP Person
ldap_person.description: The additional LDAP attributes that describe a person.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate user identifier. For example, the Active Directory user GUID or AWS user Principal ID.

dce_rpc.caption: DCE/RPC
dce_rpc.name: dce_rpc
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC, or Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call, object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments. Defined by D3FEND d3f:RemoteProcedureCall.

command_response.caption: Command Response
command_response.description: The reply to the request command (e.g. RESPONSE, BINDACK or FAULT).

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.name: organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the organization. For example, Widget, Inc.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization. For example, its Active Directory or AWS Org ID.

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of the organizational unit, within an organization.  For example, Finance, IT, R&D

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The alternate identifier for an entity's unique identifier. For example, its Active Directory OU DN or AWS OU ID.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.name: fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The hash algorithm used to create the digital fingerprint, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized hash algorithm, which was used to create the digital fingerprint.

3.caption: SHA-256
3.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value.

6.caption: TLSH
6.description: The TLSH fuzzy hashing algorithm.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: MD5
1.description: MD5 message-digest algorithm producing a 128-bit (16-byte) hash value.

2.caption: SHA-1
2.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 1 producing a 160-bit (20-byte) hash value.

4.caption: SHA-512
4.description: Secure Hash Algorithm 2 producing a 512-bit (64-byte) hash value.

5.caption: CTPH
5.description: The ssdeep generated fuzzy checksum. Also known as Context Triggered Piecewise Hash (CTPH).

7.caption: quickXorHash
7.description: Microsoft simple non-cryptographic hash algorithm that works by XORing the bytes in a circular-shifting fashion.

email.caption: Email
email.name: email
email.description: The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction. Defined by D3FEND d3f:Email.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes of the email, including attachments.

uid.caption: Email UID
uid.description: The email unique identifier.

from.caption: From
from.description: The email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322.

cc.caption: Cc
cc.description: The email header Cc values, as defined by RFC 5322.

to.caption: To
to.description: The email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

subject.caption: Subject
subject.description: The email header Subject value, as defined by RFC 5322.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-Id value, as defined by RFC 5322.

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.name: epss
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the EPSS model used to calculate the score.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The timestamp indicating when the EPSS score was calculated.

percentile.caption: EPSS Percentile
percentile.description: The EPSS score's percentile representing relative importance and ranking of the score in the larger EPSS dataset.

score.caption: EPPS Score
score.description: The EPSS score representing the probability [0-1] of exploitation in the wild in the next 30 days (following score publication).

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The timestamp indicating when the EPSS score was calculated.

job.caption: Job
job.name: job
job.description: The Job object provides information about a scheduled job or task, including its name, command line, and state. It encompasses attributes that describe the properties and status of the scheduled job.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the job.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the job.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that created the job.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the job.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the job was created.

last_run_time.caption: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The time when the job was last run.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The time when the job will next be run.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The run state of the job.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the job.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the job was created.

last_run_time_dt.caption: Last Run
last_run_time_dt.description: The time when the job was last run.

next_run_time_dt.caption: Next Run
next_run_time_dt.description: The time when the job will next be run.

endpoint.caption: Endpoint
endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: A IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

module.caption: Module
module.name: module
module.description: The Module object describes the load attributes of a module.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The module type.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. It describes how the module was loaded in memory.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the load type. It identifies how the module was loaded in memory.

3.caption: ShellCode
3.description: A raw module in process memory that is READWRITE_EXECUTE and had a thread started in its range.

1.caption: Standard
1.description: A normal module loaded by the normal windows loading mechanism i.e. LoadLibrary.

2.caption: Non Standard
2.description: A module loaded in a way avoidant of normal windows procedures. i.e. Bootstrapped Loading/Manual Dll Loading.

4.caption: Mapped
4.description: A memory mapped file, typically created with CreatefileMapping/MapViewOfFile.

5.caption: NonStandard Backed
5.description: A module loaded in a non standard way. However, GetModuleFileName succeeds on this allocation.

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

win/win_resource.caption: Windows Resource
win/win_resource.name: win_resource
win/win_resource.description: The Windows resource object describes a resource object managed by Windows, such as mutant or timer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource object.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the Windows resource object.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The Windows provided handle identifier for the resource object

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to a resource.

details.caption: Details
details.description: The string detailing the attributes of the resource object.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of the Windows resource object accessed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The resource object type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The resource object type is unknown.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The Windows service acting as the object server for the resource object, such as Security or Security Account Manager.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.name: actor
actor.description: The Actor object contains details about the user, role, application, service, or process that initiated or performed a specific activity.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that initiated the activity.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that initiated the activity or the user context from which the activity was initiated.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The user session from which the activity was initiated.

app_name.caption: Application Name
app_name.description: The client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process if present.

app_uid.caption: Application ID
app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process.pid or process.uid if present.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.description: This object describes details about the Identity Provider used.

invoked_by.caption: Invoked by
invoked_by.description: The name of the service that invoked the activity as described in the event.

data_security.caption: Data Security
data_security.name: data_security
data_security.description: The Data Security object describes the characteristics, techniques and content of a Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Loss Detection (DLD), Data Classification, or similar tools' finding, alert, or detection mechanism(s).

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

pattern_match.caption: Pattern Match
pattern_match.description: A text, binary, file name, or datastore that matched against a detection rule.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

data_lifecycle_state.caption: Data Lifecycle State
data_lifecycle_state.description: The name of the stage or state that the data was in. E.g., Data-at-Rest, Data-in-Transit, etc.

data_lifecycle_state_id.caption: Data Lifecycle State ID
data_lifecycle_state_id.description: The stage or state that the data was in when it was assessed or scanned by a data security tool.

3.caption: Data in-Use
3.description: The data was being processed, accessed, or read by a system, making it active in memory or CPU. E.g., sensitive data in a Business Intelligence tool, ePHI being processed in an EHR application or a user viewing data stored in a spreadsheet or PDF.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_lifecycle_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Data at-Rest
1.description: The data was stored on physical or logcial media and was not actively moving through the network nor was being processed. E.g., data stored in a database, PDF files in a file share, or EHR records in object storage.

2.caption: Data in-Transit
2.description: The data was actively moving through the network or from one physical or logical location to another. E.g., emails being send, data replication or Change Data Capture (CDC) streams, or sensitive data processed on an API.

detection_pattern.caption: Detection Pattern
detection_pattern.description: Specific pattern, algorithm, fingerpint, or model used for detection.

detection_system.caption: Detection System
detection_system.description: The name of the type of data security tool or system that the finding, detection, or alert originated from. E.g., Endpoint, Secure Email Gateway, etc.

detection_system_id.caption: Detection System ID
detection_system_id.description: The type of data security tool or system that the finding, detection, or alert originated from.

3.caption: Mobile Device Management
3.description: A Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies on mobile devices (e.g., cellphones, tablets, End User Devices [EUDs]).

6.caption: Secure Email Gateway
6.description: A Secure Email Gateway (SEG) is any tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies within email systems. E.g., Microsoft Defender for Office, Google Workspaces.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of detection system or a multi-variate system made up of several other systems.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the detection_system attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Endpoint
1.description: A dedicated agent or sensor installed on a device, either a dedicated data security tool or an Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Symantec DLP, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (MDE).

2.caption: DLP Gateway
2.description: A Data Loss Prevention (DLP) gateway that is positioned in-line of an information store such as a network share, a database, or otherwise that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies.

10.caption: Application-Level DLP
10.description: A built in Data Loss Prevention (DLP) or other data security capability within a tool or platform such as an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or Customer Relations Management (CRM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies.

4.caption: Data Discovery & Classification
4.description: A tool that actively identifies and classifies sensitive data in digitial media and information stores in accordance with a policy or automated functionality. E.g, Amazon Macie, Microsoft Purview.

5.caption: Secure Web Gateway
5.description: A Secure Web Gateway (SWG) is any tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies at a network-edge such as within a proxy or firewall service.

7.caption: Digital Rights Management
7.description: A Digital Rights Management (DRM) or a dedicated Information Rights Management (IRM) are tools which can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies on digitial media via policy or user access rights.

8.caption: Cloud Access Security Broker
8.description: A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies in-line to cloud systems such as the public cloud or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) tool. E.g., Forcepoint CASB, SkyHigh Security.

9.caption: Database Activity Monitoring
9.description: A Database Activity Monitoring (DAM) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies as part of a dedicated database or warehouse monitoring solution.

11.caption: Developer Security
11.description: Any Developer Security tool such as an Infrastrucre-as-Securty (IAC) scanner, Secrets Detection, or Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC) tool that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies. E.g., TruffleHog, GitGuardian, Git-Secrets.

12.caption: Data Security Posture Management
12.description: A Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) tool is a continuous monitoring and data discovery solution that can detect sensitive data and/or enforce data security policies for local and cloud environments. E.g., Cyera, Sentra, IBM Polar Security.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the policy that triggered the finding.

logger.caption: Logger
logger.name: logger
logger.description: The Logger object represents the device and product where events are stored with times for receipt and transmission.  This may be at the source device where the event occurred, a remote scanning device, intermediate hops, or the ultimate destination.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the logging product instance.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the logging product.

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device where the events are logged.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product logging the event.  This may be the event source product, a management server product, a scanning product, a SIEM, etc.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the logging product instance.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.name: cvss
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CVSS version. For example: 3.1.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 – 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 – 6.9)
  • High (7.0 – 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics. This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: { {"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.name: data_classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the data policy that governs data handling and security measures related to classification.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.name: sub_technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: Scanning IP Blocks.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: T1595.001.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/001/.

attack.caption: MITRE ATT&CK®
attack.name: attack
attack.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® object describes the tactic, technique & sub-technique associated to an attack as defined in ATT&CK MatrixTM.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The ATT&CK MatrixTM version.

tactics.caption: Tactics
tactics.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or tactic name that are associated with the attack technique, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

technique.caption: Technique
technique.description: The Technique object describes the technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

sub_technique.caption: Sub Technique
sub_technique.description: The Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

tactic.caption: Tactic
tactic.description: The Tactic object describes the tactic ID and/or name that is associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK MatrixTM.

cis_csc.caption: CIS CSC
cis_csc.name: cis_csc
cis_csc.description: The CIS Critical Security Control (CSC) contains information as defined by the Center for Internet Security Critical Security Control (CIS CSC). Prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS critical security control version.

endpoint_connection.caption: Endpoint Connection
endpoint_connection.name: endpoint_connection
endpoint_connection.description: The Endpoint Connection object contains information detailing a connection attempt to an endpoint.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: A numerical response status code providing details about the connection.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.description: Provides characteristics of the network endpoint.

database.caption: Database
database.name: database
database.description: The database object is used for databases which are typically datastore services that contain an organized collection of structured and unstructured data or a types of data.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The database name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the database in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The database type.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the database.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the database.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the database belongs.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the database type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the database was known to have been created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

network_traffic.caption: Network Traffic
network_traffic.name: network_traffic
network_traffic.description: The Network Traffic object describes characteristics of network traffic. Network traffic refers to data moving across a network at a given point of time. Defined by D3FEND d3f:NetworkTraffic.

bytes_in.caption: Bytes In
bytes_in.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source.

bytes_out.caption: Bytes Out
bytes_out.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination.

chunks.caption: Chunks
chunks.description: The total number of chunks (in and out).

bytes.caption: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The total number of bytes (in and out).

chunks_in.caption: Chunks In
chunks_in.description: The number of chunks sent from the destination to the source.

chunks_out.caption: Chunks Out
chunks_out.description: The number of chunks sent from the source to the destination.

packets.caption: Total Packets
packets.description: The total number of packets (in and out).

packets_in.caption: Packets In
packets_in.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source.

packets_out.caption: Packets Out
packets_out.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination.

kill_chain_phase.caption: Kill Chain Phase
kill_chain_phase.name: kill_chain_phase
kill_chain_phase.description: The Kill Chain Phase object represents a single phase of a cyber attack, including the initial reconnaissance and planning stages up to the final objective of the attacker. It provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack. See Cyber Kill Chain®.

phase_id.caption: Kill Chain Phase ID
phase_id.description: The cyber kill chain phase identifier.

3.caption: Delivery
3.description: The intruders will use various tactics, such as phishing, infected USB drives, etc.

6.caption: Command & Control
6.description: Malware opens a command channel to enable the intruders to remotely manipulate the victim's system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The kill chain phase is not mapped. See the phase attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The kill chain phase is unknown.

1.caption: Reconnaissance
1.description: The attackers pick a target and perform a detailed analysis, start collecting information (email addresses, conferences information, etc.) and evaluate the victim’s vulnerabilities to determine how to exploit them.

2.caption: Weaponization
2.description: The attackers develop a malware weapon and aim to exploit the discovered vulnerabilities.

4.caption: Exploitation
4.description: The intruders start leveraging vulnerabilities to executed code on the victim’s system.

5.caption: Installation
5.description: The intruders install malware on the victim’s system.

7.caption: Actions on Objectives
7.description: With hands-on keyboard access, intruders accomplish the mission’s goal.

account.caption: Account
account.name: account
account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the account (e.g. GCP Account Name).

type.caption: Type
type.description: The account type, normalized to the caption of 'account_type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the account (e.g. AWS Account ID).

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels/tags associated to the account.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The account type is not mapped.

object.caption: Object
object.name: object
object.description: An unordered collection of attributes. It defines a set of attributes available in all objects. It can be also used as a generic object to log objects that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

kernel_driver.caption: Kernel Extension
kernel_driver.name: kernel_driver
kernel_driver.description: The Kernel Extension object describes a kernel driver that has been loaded or unloaded into the operating system (OS) kernel. Defined by D3FEND d3f:KernelModule.

win/reg_value.caption: Registry Value
win/reg_value.name: reg_value
win/reg_value.description: The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data of the registry value.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the registry value.

type.caption: Type
type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.name: agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.

name.caption: Agent Name
name.description: The name of the agent or sensor. For example: AWS SSM Agent.

type.caption: Agent Type
type.description: The normalized caption of the type_id value for the agent or sensor. In the case of 'Other' or 'Unknown', it is defined by the event source.

version.caption: Agent Version
version.description: The semantic version of the agent or sensor, e.g., 7.101.50.0.

uid.caption: Agent ID
uid.description: The UID of the agent or sensor, sometimes known as a Sensor ID or aid.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized representation of an agent or sensor. E.g., EDR, vulnerability management, APM, backup & recovery, etc.

3.caption: Backup & Recovery
3.description: Any agent or sensor that provides backups, archival, or recovery capabilities. E.g., Azure Backup, AWS Backint Agent.

6.caption: Log Forwarding
6.description: Any agent or sensor that forwards logs to a 3rd party storage system such as a data lake or SIEM. E.g., Splunk Universal Forwarder, Tenzir, FluentBit, Amazon CloudWatch Agent, Amazon Kinesis Agent.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Endpoint Detection and Response
1.description: Any EDR sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar threat detection, anti-malware, anti-ransomware, or similar capabilities. E.g., Crowdstrike Falcon, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Wazuh.

2.caption: Data Loss Prevention
2.description: Any DLP sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar data classification, data loss detection, and/or data loss prevention capabilities. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Microsoft Purview, Symantec DLP.

4.caption: Performance Monitoring & Observability
4.description: Any agent or sensor that provides Application Performance Monitoring (APM), active tracing, profiling, or other observability use cases and optionally forwards the logs. E.g., New Relic Agent, Datadog Agent, Azure Monitor Agent.

5.caption: Vulnerability Management
5.description: Any agent or sensor that provides vulnerability management or scanning capabilities. E.g., Qualys VMDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Crowdstrike Spotlight, Amazon Inspector Agent.

7.caption: Mobile Device Management
7.description: Any agent or sensor responsible for providing Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Mobile Enterprise Management (MEM) capabilities. E.g., JumpCloud Agent, Esper Agent, Jamf Pro binary.

8.caption: Configuration Management
8.description: Any agent or sensor that provides configuration management of a device, such as scanning for software, license management, or applying configurations. E.g., AWS Systems Manager Agent, Flexera, ServiceNow MID Server.

9.caption: Remote Access
9.description: Any agent or sensor that provides remote access capabilities to a device. E.g., BeyondTrust, Amazon Systems Manager Agent, Verkada Agent.

policies.caption: Agent Policies
policies.description: Describes the various policies that may be applied or enforced by an agent or sensor. E.g., Conditional Access, prevention, auto-update, tamper protection, destination configuration, etc.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate Agent ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the agent or sensor, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The company or author who created the agent or sensor. For example: Crowdstrike.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.name: policy
policy.description:
The Policy object describes the policies that are applicable.

Policy attributes provide traceability to the operational state of the security product at the time that the event was captured, facilitating forensics, troubleshooting, and policy tuning/adjustments.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The policy name. For example: IAM Policy.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The policy version number.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the policy.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier of the policy instance.

is_applied.caption: Applied
is_applied.description: A determination if the content of a policy was applied to a target or request, or not.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description: The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description: Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description: Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. A domain name in general is an Internet address that can be resolved through the Domain Name System (DNS). For example: r2-d2.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description: Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example, 192.168.200.24 or 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

mac_t.caption: MAC Address
mac_t.description: Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example: 18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

port_t.caption: Port
port_t.description: The TCP/UDP port number. For example: 80 or 22.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet.
For example:
  • 192.168.1.0/24
  • 2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description: The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example 1618524549901.

url_t.caption: URL String
url_t.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

base_event.caption: Base Event
base_event.name: base_event

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

duration.caption: Duration
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

0.caption: Base Event
0.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Base Event.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Details
status_detail.description: The status details contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

base_event.description: The base event is a generic and concrete event. It also defines a set of attributes available in most event classes. As a generic event that does not belong to any event category, it could be used to log events that are not otherwise defined by the schema.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.name: cloud
cloud.description: The attributes that describe information specific to Cloud services/applications.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

container.caption: Container
container.name: container
container.description: The container context for a process.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.name: data_classification
data_classification.description: The attributes that describe information specific to data classification.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

datetime.caption: Date/Time
datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: This profile defines date/time attributes as defined in RFC-3339. For example 1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z.

host.caption: Host
host.name: host
host.description: The attributes that identify host/device attributes.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity.

linux/linux_users.caption: Linux
linux/linux_users.name: linux_users
linux/linux_users.description: The attributes that Linux uses to identify user information.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group under which this process is running.

auid.caption: Audit User ID
auid.description: The audit user assigned at login by the audit subsystem.

euid.caption: Effective User ID
euid.description: The effective user under which this process is running.

egid.caption: Effective Group ID
egid.description: The effective group under which this process is running.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.name: load_balancer
load_balancer.description: The attributes that describe information specific to load balancers.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.description: The Load Balancer object contains information related to the device that is distributing incoming traffic to specified destinations.

network_proxy.caption: Network Proxy
network_proxy.name: network_proxy
network_proxy.description: The attributes that identify network proxy attributes.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

security_control.caption: Security Control
security_control.name: security_control
security_control.description: The attributes including disposition that represent the outcome of a security control including but not limited to access control, malware or policy violation, network proxy, firewall, or data control.  The profile is intended to augment activities or findings with an outcome where a security control has intervened.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not listed. The disposition attribute should be populated with a source specific caption.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing the tactics, techniques & sub-techniques identified by a security control or finding.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. Dispositions conform to an action of 1 'Allowed' or 2 'Denied' in most cases. Note that 99 'Other' is not an option. No action would equate to 1 'Allowed'. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Count', 'Uncorrected', 'Isolated', 'Quarantined' or 'Exonerated'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that triggered the event.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

linux.name: linux
linux.caption: Linux
linux.description: The Linux extension defines Linux specific attributes, objects and classes.

win.name: win
win.caption: Windows
win.description: The Windows extension defines Windows specific attributes, objects and classes.

scheduled_job_activity.caption: Scheduled Job Activity
scheduled_job_activity.name: scheduled_job_activity
scheduled_job_activity.description: Scheduled Job Activity events report activities related to scheduled jobs or tasks.

file_activity.caption: File System Activity
file_activity.name: file_activity
file_activity.description: File System Activity events report when a process performs an action on a file or folder.

kernel_extension.caption: Kernel Extension Activity
kernel_extension.name: kernel_extension
kernel_extension.description: Kernel Extension events report when a driver/extension is loaded or unloaded into the kernel

process_activity.caption: Process Activity
process_activity.name: process_activity
process_activity.description: Process Activity events report when a process launches, injects, opens or terminates another process, successful or otherwise.

module_activity.caption: Module Activity
module_activity.name: module_activity
module_activity.description: Module Activity events report when a process loads or unloads the module.

memory_activity.caption: Memory Activity
memory_activity.name: memory_activity
memory_activity.description: Memory Activity events report when a process has memory allocated, read/modified, or other manipulation activities - such as a buffer overflow or turning off data execution protection (DEP).

kernel_activity.caption: Kernel Activity
kernel_activity.name: kernel_activity
kernel_activity.description: Kernel Activity events report when an process creates, reads, or deletes a kernel resource.

win/resource_activity.caption: Windows Resource Activity
win/resource_activity.name: resource_activity
win/resource_activity.description: Windows Resource Activity events report when a process accesses a Windows managed resource object, successful or otherwise.

win/registry_key_activity.caption: Registry Key Activity
win/registry_key_activity.name: registry_key_activity
win/registry_key_activity.description: Registry Key Activity events report when a process performs an action on a Windows registry key.

win/registry_value_activity.caption: Registry Value Activity
win/registry_value_activity.name: registry_value_activity
win/registry_value_activity.description: Registry Value Activity events reports when a process performs an action on a Windows registry value.

application.name: application
application.caption: Application Activity
application.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

web_resource_access_activity.caption: Web Resource Access Activity
web_resource_access_activity.name: web_resource_access_activity
web_resource_access_activity.description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.

scan_activity.caption: Scan Activity
scan_activity.name: scan_activity
scan_activity.description: Scan events report the start, completion, and results of a scan job. The scan event includes the number of items that were scanned and the number of detections that were resolved.

file_hosting.caption: File Hosting Activity
file_hosting.name: file_hosting
file_hosting.description: File Hosting Activity events report the actions taken by file management applications, including file sharing servers like Sharepoint and services such as Box, MS OneDrive, or Google Drive.

datastore_activity.caption: Datastore Activity
datastore_activity.name: datastore_activity
datastore_activity.description: Datastore events describe general activities (Read, Update, Query, Delete, etc.) which affect datastores or data within those datastores, e.g. (AWS RDS, AWS S3).

web_resources_activity.caption: Web Resources Activity
web_resources_activity.name: web_resources_activity
web_resources_activity.description: Web Resources Activity events describe actions executed on a set of Web Resources.

api_activity.caption: API Activity
api_activity.name: api_activity
api_activity.description: API events describe general CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) API activities, e.g. (AWS Cloudtrail)

application_lifecycle.caption: Application Lifecycle
application_lifecycle.name: application_lifecycle
application_lifecycle.description: Application Lifecycle events report installation, removal, start, stop of an application or service.

findings.name: findings
findings.caption: Findings
findings.description: Findings events report findings, detections, and possible resolutions of malware, anomalies, or other actions performed by security products.

compliance_finding.caption: Compliance Finding
compliance_finding.name: compliance_finding
compliance_finding.description: Compliance Finding events describe results of evaluations performed against resources, to check compliance with various Industry Frameworks or Security Standards such as NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001 etc.

security_finding.caption: Security Finding
security_finding.name: security_finding
security_finding.description: Security Finding events describe findings, detections, anomalies, alerts and/or actions performed by security products

detection_finding.caption: Detection Finding
detection_finding.name: detection_finding
detection_finding.description: A Detection Finding describes detections or alerts generated by security products using correlation engines, detection engines or other methodologies. Note: if the product is a security control, the security_control profile should be applied and its attacks information should be duplicated into the finding_info object.

data_security_finding.caption: Data Security Finding
data_security_finding.name: data_security_finding
data_security_finding.description: A Data Security Finding describes detections or alerts generated by various data security products such as Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Data Classification, Secrets Management, Digital Rights Management (DRM), Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), and similar tools. These detections or alerts can be created using fingerprinting, statistical analysis, machine learning or other methodologies. The finding describes the actors and endpoints who accessed or own the sensitive data, as well as the resources which store the sensitive data.

vulnerability_finding.caption: Vulnerability Finding
vulnerability_finding.name: vulnerability_finding
vulnerability_finding.description: The Vulnerability Finding event is a notification about weakness in an information system, system security procedures, internal controls, or implementation that could be exploited or triggered by a threat source.

incident_finding.caption: Incident Finding
incident_finding.name: incident_finding
incident_finding.description: An Incident Finding reports the creation, update, or closure of security incidents as a result of detections and/or analytics.

iam.name: iam
iam.caption: Identity & Access Management
iam.description: Identity & Access Management (IAM) events relate to the supervision of the system's authentication and access control model. Examples of such events are the success or failure of authentication, granting of authority, password change, entity change, privileged use etc.

authentication.caption: Authentication
authentication.name: authentication
authentication.description: Authentication events report authentication session activities such as user attempts a logon or logoff, successfully or otherwise.

authorize_session.caption: Authorize Session
authorize_session.name: authorize_session
authorize_session.description: Authorize Session events report privileges or groups assigned to a new user session, usually at login time.

entity_management.caption: Entity Management
entity_management.name: entity_management
entity_management.description: Entity Management events report activity by a managed client, a micro service, or a user at a management console. The activity can be a create, read, update, and delete operation on a managed entity.

group_management.caption: Group Management
group_management.name: group_management
group_management.description: Group Management events report management updates to a group, including updates to membership and permissions.

user_access.caption: User Access Management
user_access.name: user_access
user_access.description: User Access Management events report management updates to a user's privileges.

account_change.caption: Account Change
account_change.name: account_change
account_change.description: Account Change events report when specific user account management tasks are performed, such as a user/role being created, changed, deleted, renamed, disabled, enabled, locked out or unlocked.

network_file_activity.caption: Network File Activity
network_file_activity.name: network_file_activity
network_file_activity.description: Network File Activity events report file activities traversing the network, including file storage services such as Box, MS OneDrive, or Google Drive.

rdp_activity.caption: RDP Activity
rdp_activity.name: rdp_activity
rdp_activity.description: Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) Activity events report remote client connections to a server as seen on the network.

dhcp_activity.caption: DHCP Activity
dhcp_activity.name: dhcp_activity
dhcp_activity.description: DHCP Activity events report MAC to IP assignment via DHCP from a client or server.

ntp_activity.caption: NTP Activity
ntp_activity.name: ntp_activity
ntp_activity.description: The Network Time Protocol (NTP) Activity events report instances of remote clients synchronizing their clocks with an NTP server, as observed on the network.

email_activity.caption: Email Activity
email_activity.name: email_activity
email_activity.description: Email events report activities of emails.

dns_activity.caption: DNS Activity
dns_activity.name: dns_activity
dns_activity.description: DNS Activity events report DNS queries and answers as seen on the network.

ftp_activity.caption: FTP Activity
ftp_activity.name: ftp_activity
ftp_activity.description: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) Activity events report file transfers between a server and a client as seen on the network.

tunnel_activity.caption: Tunnel Activity
tunnel_activity.name: tunnel_activity
tunnel_activity.description: Tunnel Activity events report secure tunnel establishment (such as VPN), teardowns, renewals, and other network tunnel specific actions.

email_url_activity.caption: Email URL Activity
email_url_activity.name: email_url_activity
email_url_activity.description: Email URL Activity events report URLs within an email.

network_activity.caption: Network Activity
network_activity.name: network_activity
network_activity.description: Network Activity events report network connection and traffic activity.

http_activity.caption: HTTP Activity
http_activity.name: http_activity
http_activity.description: HTTP Activity events report HTTP connection and traffic information.

ssh_activity.caption: SSH Activity
ssh_activity.name: ssh_activity
ssh_activity.description: SSH Activity events report remote client connections to a server using the Secure Shell (SSH) Protocol.

email_file_activity.caption: Email File Activity
email_file_activity.name: email_file_activity
email_file_activity.description: Email File Activity events report files within emails.

smb_activity.caption: SMB Activity
smb_activity.name: smb_activity
